line_1: His arched verdure does its roof invest;
line_2: And with his kindness makes its owner blest.

line_1: Which rapidly th' horizon round invest,
line_2: Whilst in the blushing chambers of the west,

line_1: With all his strength the monarch's limbs invest,
line_2: Or pour his valour in the royal breast.

line_1: Now in her Turn, Nights Gloomy Shades invest
line_2: The Ruddy Glories of the shining West,

line_1: Now in her Turn, Nights Gloomy Shades invest
line_2: And weaken'd Nature seeks Recruit by Rest:

line_1: Long eagle plumes his arching neck invest,
line_2: Steal round his arms, and clasp his sharpen'd breast;

line_1: No more the envied robe his limbs invest,
line_2: In all the pomp of eastern monarchs drest.

line_1: But meteors glare, and stormy glooms invest.
line_2: No zephyr fondly foothes the mountain's breast,

line_1: 'Tis plain, the creature whom he chose t' invest
line_2: With kingship and dominion o'er the rest,

line_1: Why should fell darkness half the South invest?
line_2: While the chill North with thy bright ray is blest,
And gleam'd on wise Godolphin's breast.
